file_content.text: I've heard the Republic might actually send some troops to get all of these children out of here. Thank you.
Go on and talk to the Republic. See if they'll actually do anything for these children.
Please, Doctor Jaen? Please?
Just a minute, Daek.
You're not with the separatists, judging from the bloodbath. What are you doing here? What do you want?
If you mean to harm these children, I won't let it happen.
I'm here to help.
Rescue me? You're kidding.
You're Doctor Jaen Kett, I take it.
Doctor?
Yes--the Republic sent you to get me out of here, didn't they?
Put your swimming trunks on, doc. We're leaving.
Get ready to leave.
The Republic sent you, didn't they?
There are people on this island who need saving more than I do. The Republic shouldn't waste its time on one man.
And besides, I can't leave the island.
I have orders to bring you back, and I'm not leaving without you.
I have a job to do.
Listen, I was hired to bring you back, and you'll go.
I have a job to do.
I told you--I can't leave the island.
Are you deliberately disobeying the Republic? Don't make me arrest you.
That sounds like treason.
No--I'm loyal to the Republic, through and through. But I can't leave.
Can't swim?
No, I'm not afraid--but I just can't leave.
It's--it's the children. They need me. They're orphans, most of them. Their parents were killed during the fighting over Mannett Point.
A few of them have family on the other side, but they're too young to swim that far. They all need food and medicine. I won't leave them here.
Can't we get them off the island, too?
We'll move them also.
It's too far a swim....
Republic troops are dying without your aid.
You're needed.
These children will die without my aid.
I will take you at gunpoint if necessary.
Don't make me force you.
How can you be so callous?
I am a doctor. If I don't help the innocent, who will? The separatists focus blindly on their cause while food and supplies dwindle daily.
The Republic won't help, either. I've seen the corruption in their ranks. They don't care about the people of Mannett Point.
I'm sure the Republic would help if they knew.
That's not true.
You have more faith than I have. But I'll cut you a deal--if you can convince the Republic to send help for these children, I'll return to Fort Garnik.
I'd caution you not to speak poorly of the Republic during a war, doctor.
Watch what you say.
Last I heard, the Republic wasn't in the business of convicting people of treason for simply speaking their minds. I'm no separatist, but I won't let these children suffer.
Not my problem.
I won't go back without these children. And since it's clear that you're not interested in helping, I'm not going back at all.
Fine, I'll help.
I doubt the Republic's going to requisition boats just because you said so. Here, I'll write out what I need and sign it.
Plead your case before the commanders.
Come with me.
Nice try. But I'm not going back until I know for sure these kids will be safe.
Here--I wouldn't want to send you back empty-handed. I'll write down everything these kids will need and sign it.
At least they won't laugh at you then. And if you can get them to come and save these children, then I'll come back, too.
Deal.
The Republic won't let you down.
We won't fail you.
See you at Fort Garnik!
Goodbye.
I'll believe it when I see it.
You don't have a choice.
No, you are. [Threaten him]
You wouldn't--you're heartless, and in front of the children even! I'd expect this from the separatists but not the Republic!
If you kill me, then everyone loses. The children will have no one, and you'll still have failed your job.
Here--take this list to whoever sent you. It's everything these children will need to make it out of here. Tell them I'm not coming back without these kids.
Deal.
A lot of good soldiers will die without your help.
You can't do this.
At least soldiers get a fighting chance. These children won't.
If I lose my pay on this, I'll make you regret it.
I'd better still get paid.
I have no doubt.
You're really pushing me, doctor.
Watch it.
Someone has to push for the people who can't.
Now hurry, please.
Don't worry, kids. Doctor Jaen's taking good care of you.
